intro: Convolvulus falkia, commonly known as Falkia bindweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often with five petals. Its vines can grow up to several meters in length, and it has heart-shaped leaves that are usually hairy. Falkia bindweed is often found in rocky areas and along coastal regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
